author: brianary
body: I'd like to request and track FSharp support in Add-Type (separate from the broader #5725 ). FSharp's syntax seems to lend itself optimally well to the kind of terse type and member definitions that are passed to Add-Type.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
Today MSFT team plan to remove VisualBasic support in order to reduce distributive size. So adding F# looks unreal in near future.
We could consider refactor Add-Type to support an addins from optional modules.

comments.author: brianary
comments.body: That's disappointing. Hopefully something that dynamically uses what languages are available on the system would be an option in the future.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: In #5725 I see a few votes. If we get a lot of votes then we can get approval from PowerShell Committee.

comments.author: brianary
comments.body: It seems like a closed issue is unlikely to get a lot of votes, though. And given that #5725 covers several different features, I thought an open issue specific to one feature would be more effective.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: If you are from F# community then ask there for a vote.

title: Add-Type -Language FSharp
